content.question: The <math alttext="L D 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD50</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for arsenic in humans is <math alttext="13 milligrams per kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg/kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following approaches should be used to calculate the number of grams of arsenic it would take to reach the <math alttext="L D 50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LD50</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in a 140-pound person? [Note: <math alttext="1 kilogram equals 2.2 pounds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>2.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>pounds</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>]

choices.label: <math alttext="140 pounds times the fraction 2.2 pounds per 1 kilogram, times the fraction 1 kilogram per 13 milligrams, times the fraction 1 gram per 1,000 milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>140</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="140 pounds times the fraction 1 kilogram per 2.2 pounds, times the fraction 13 milligrams per 1 kilogram, times the fraction 1 gram per 1,000 milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>140</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The fraction 13 milligrams per 1 kilogram, times 50 times 140 pounds, times the fraction 1 kilogram per 2.2 pounds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>140</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="The fraction 13 milligrams per 1 kilogram, times the fraction 1 kilogram per 2.2 pounds, times the fraction 140 pounds over 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>140</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="140 pounds times the fraction 1 kilogram per 2.2 pounds, times the fraction 13 milligrams per 1 kilogram, times the fraction 1 gram per 1,000 milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>140</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>lb</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 6.A: Determine an approach or method aligned with the problem to be solved.
